title: How did James Joyce and Jorge Luis Borges influence Umberto Eco? - Quora

response.answer_text: - Both Umberto Eco, in The Name of the Rose, and James Joyce, in Ulysses and Finnegan's Wake, indulge in 'heteroglossia', speeches consisting in a medley of languages.- The librarian's name in Umberto Eco's The Name of the Rose is Jorge de Burgos, a reference to Jorge Luis Borges, while the library is inspired by the Argentinian writer's short story TheLibrary of Babel (and by Escher's architecture).
